creditline: Gift of funds from Mr. and Mrs. Wayne MacFarlane
description: pair of Hepplewhite Side Chairs, c.1795, mahogany. Beaded gothic arches with acorn finials, carved husks and ears of wheat which extend onto the serpentine crest rails, saddle shaped seats and moulded legs connected by stretchers.
text: Stephen Badlam was a leading American furniture maker during the Federal period.  He set up his shop in Dorchester Lower Mills, Massachusetts, and was one of a number of furniture makers to mark his furniture with a stamp.  Badlam and many of his peers drew inspiration from British design source books such as George Hepplewhite's Cabinet-Maker and Upholsterer's Guide (1788).  This chair is one of a pair; the other is currently on view nearby in the MacFarlane Room.
title: Hepplewhite side chair, one of a pair
